page.title: 11The canal at Bolton-le-Sands
page.content: The canal at Bolton-le-Sands is part of the Lancaster canal which connects Preston with Kendal. It runs in a north/south direction. The engineer who built the canal was called John Rennie. The purpose of the canal was to provide cheap{transport}for the movement of coal, limestone, timber and other commodities. Today, two main types of boats use the canal: pleasure boats and narrow boats. The canal is also used for other activities including fishing and cruising. You can hire a boat and it will take you past reed covered banking which is gradually crumbling away because of erosion. Today, the maintenance of the canal is the responsibility of the British Waterways Board.
